Record.ClassificationPath: Nutritional and Metabolic Diseases/Nutrition Disorders/Malnutrition/Refeeding Syndrome
Record.Description: A condition of metabolic imbalance that is caused by complications of initially feeding a severely malnourished patient too aggressively. Usually occurring within the first 5 days of refeeding, this syndrome is characterized by WATER-ELECTROLYTE IMBALANCE; GLUCOSE INTOLERANCE; CARDIAC ARRHYTHMIAS; and DIARRHEA.
